meanings.definition: Causing one to feel bored or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: The long lecture was tiresome for the students.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive task became tiresome after a while.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending story became quite tiresome, but we couldn't stop reading.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise outside was like a tiresome mosquito buzzing in my ear.
meanings.sent5: The dull gray walls of the waiting room made the atmosphere even more tiresome.

meanings.sent1: The tiresome job required doing the same thing over and over.
meanings.sent2: The endless paperwork was truly tiresome for the employees.
meanings.sent3: The tiresome routine of waking up, going to work, and coming home repeated every day.
meanings.sent4: The tiresome rain tapped on the roof like a monotonous drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The tiresome ticking of the clock echoed through the empty room.
